website_summaries.verdict: The Fizik Terra Powerstrap X4 is a gravel-specific bike shoe. It is designed for adventurous rides with essential features needed for power transfer and comfort.The shoe is adored for its simple yet stylish looks, efficiency and versatility. Despite some misfires, the Terra Powerstrap X4 could be for you if you're looking for a pair optimized for gravel but could also double as normal MTB shoes.
pros: Most of the Fizik Terra Powerstrap X4 owners rave over the shoe's comfort
Majority of the buyers find this Fizik MTB shoe to be stylish and good-looking
The Powerstrap closure works well and allows easy on and off, according to plenty of its users
The Terra Powerstrap X4's soles yield enough power transfer for gravel cycling as well as walking comfort, say several cyclists
It has excellent quality and craftsmanship, mention some wearers
A couple of users appreciate its lightweight feel
cons: Some gravel cyclists say that the shoe's grip is not best for muddy trails
An owner says he would've rated it 5 out 5 if it had reflective elements
A buyer finds this MTB shoes a bit expensive

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable and stiff. The Velcro strap situation works well. Size runs large 1/2 size (bought a pair for myself and someone else). Sleek looking shoes for MTB, I use them for road and it’s nice that they look like road shoes.
customer_reviews.author: majortomiscominghome

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable with a secure fit - exactly what I was looking for. Sizing: I typically wear 10.5 or 11, therefore I opted for the 44.5.
customer_reviews.author: Mau

customer_reviews.title: Great for road if you prefer an SPD pedal
customer_reviews.text: Initially thought they would be too narrow when I pulled them out of the box but they somehow accommodated my somewhat wide foot. I’ve put about 200 miles on these to date and haven’t had any problems.
customer_reviews.author: JMILLZ

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, bit slim
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They’re stylish and clean looking. I wear a 9-9.5 in women’s shoes and I ordered a 41 because my work boots and my tennis shoes are a 41, should’ve maybe ordered a 41.5, they’re pretty slim and after about an hour my feet are ready to get out of them- but I’ve only had them a couple weeks so could need to wear them in. All black was unavailable on the Fizik website, so I found them here for the same price. Happy with them, would recommend. Also should note I’m using these on an indoor spin bike with Venmo SPD pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: Road-like shoes for SPD
customer_reviews.text: Recently took up gravel and decided my SpeedPlay cleats just couldn't cope with the dust. Shopping around, I have to admit, I was drawn to these Fizik's largely for aesthetic reasons - the look like a road shoe and come at a bargain price. I've been very pleased so far. The sole isn't as stiff as my road shoes, and I'm told that is a good thing for gravel anyway, they're easy to adjust and to walk in. They're not super easy to clean after a dusty ride, but that's probably true of most shoes. I'd definitely get these again, though, and might consider a road Powerstrap pair when it's time for a replacement, too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my first cycling shoes. I primarily bike on the streets and a few times on gravel roads. For an SPD pedal you normally can’t find shoes with a great look and design like these. The double strap works very well and provides great stability and power to your pedaling. They’re very light and the size runs very similar than a normal shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Andres SL

customer_reviews.title: Very very good
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t know what to expect with these. Having moved away from traditional road shoes to MTB variety of the last few years (mtb shoes seem to wider overall) fizik’s gravel specific shoe sounded interesting Ok. So. For real. They comfortable. Yes they are narrow (i dont have a super wide foot @ 13.5) but not insanely narrow. The straps make the shoe a little more forgiving up top (some give over what you’ll find with a ratchet or BOA system) I’m using them with SPDs. No issues with clearance getting into the pedals or flex around the cleat area when pedaling Hopefully they stand up to heavy use
customer_reviews.author: allonespeed

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, comfortable and efficient
customer_reviews.text: These are the best bicycle shoe I have ever owned. Great touring shoe. Power transfer is great for a shoe that is easy to walk in. They are simple to adjust while riding. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: erickf

customer_reviews.title: Finally, wide bike shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband's toes always fell asleep in his bike shoes, one ride in these are he was SO happy! His ride was so much more enjoyable and they look awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Justine Nemeth

customer_reviews.title: Great all round shoes
customer_reviews.text: Comfy, stylish, simple, plenty stiff enough and plenty of room for my wide feet (very few cycling shoes check all of those boxes). Love the Velcro fasteners. These shoes have become my go to for commuting and longer rides - on the road and on the gravel.
customer_reviews.author: Submarine man

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, good quality shoe.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value, great material for gravel biking. Seem well made. They are fairly narrow, so not a good purchase for people with wide feet.
customer_reviews.author: IDG

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: honestly there is not much to say about this. it works. comfortable, simple, and fits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: MST

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is absolutely, in my opinion, a perfect choice!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is absolutely, in my opinion, a perfect choice! I've had them for less than a day & have already fallen in love! They will be great for my double century.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes. A little too stiff. Not the most comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Tom G

customer_reviews.title: Good road bike shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes 10.5 get 44 not 44.5 just a hair bigger than I like but feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Larrabee

customer_reviews.title: Great pair
customer_reviews.text: Just started getting into cycling and these shoes were perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Great walkable cleats but stiff enough for performance
customer_reviews.text: love the look of the shoes and great for value, just wish they were a little stiffer over all a great buy for anyone who wants cleats they can walk in
customer_reviews.author: Andric

customer_reviews.title: Comfort of shoes.
customer_reviews.text: The cycling shoes were stiff, however, after three rides, they fit well. I will purchase another pair for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Green

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable shoes. I’ve rode them for about 200 miles so far and I have no complaints. Run true to size. I ordered a 38 and I’m usually a size 7, sometimes 6.5.
customer_reviews.author: Tamar

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are ideal for this type of pedal that I am using. They are also very comfortable and I enjoy the velcro straps. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: cycling is a great sport

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cycling shoes for gravel riding
customer_reviews.text: These are great cycling shoes for gravel riding. The strap system is easy to control even mid ride. They look pretty darn cool too.
customer_reviews.author: William Thompson

product_meta.title: Terra Powerstrap X4
product_meta.description:
Mixing terrain, grinding gravel or gliding through flowy singletrack: these shoes are designed to take you where regular road shoes can’t. To suit what today’s gravel-orientated adventure cyclists want, we designed the Powerstrap X4 to be simple, efficient and reliable. In line with this approach we equipped it with the innovative Powerstrap Velcro closure, designed for an enveloping fit. While most traditional Velcro closures just pull together two sides of the shoe’s upper, in the Powerstrap configuration a ribbon wraps around the foot, providing secure containment using just two straps.
The instep and the midfoot are separately adjustable for customized fit and compression. For these versatile shoes we developed a specific outsole, the X4: a carefully considered combination of stiffness and comfort, to turn pedals effectively on mixed surfaces; blending nylon – with targeted stiffness – and a rubber tread for effective grip and durability.

FEATURES
Powerstrap: foot-wrapping Velcro closure designed for an enveloping fit
X4 outsole: targeted stiffness and rubber tread for mixed surfaces 


SPECIFICATIONS
X4 nylon outsole – with rubber tread, stiffness index 6
Weight: 339g (size 42) Sizes: 36-48 (37 to 47 also in half sizes)


COLOURS
Black / Black
Anthracite / Grape
Mud / Caramel
feature_bullets: POWERSTRAP X4 is a versatile and omnipresent gravel-focused shoe designed for drop-bar riders whose adventures and aspirations take them beyond traditional paved roads. By mixing the ground, grinding gravel or sliding through smooth singletracks, these shoes are designed to take you where normal road shoes cannot.

To meet the needs of today's gravel-oriented adventure riders, we have designed Powerstrap X4 so that it is simple, efficient and reliable. In line with this approach, we have equipped it with the innovative Powerstrap Velcro closure, designed for a snug fit.

While most traditional Velcro fasteners simply combine two sides of the shoe upper, in the Powerstrap configuration a tape wraps the foot, providing secure containment using only two straps. The instep and the middle of the foot are individually adjustable for custom fit and compression.

For these versatile shoes we have developed a specific sole, the X4: a carefully designed combination of rigidity and comfort to effectively turn pedals on mixed surfaces; mixing nylon - with targeted rigidity - and rubber tread for effective grip and durability.

specifications.Sport: Training, Cycling, Triathlon, Camping & Hiking, Outdoor Lifestyle
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars14 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
